title: index
plain:
Emma Reyes

Contemporary Mixed Media Artist

Welcome to My Creative Space

Hello! I'm Emma, a mixed media artist based in Portland, creating works that blur the boundaries between painting, collage, and textile art. My pieces explore themes of memory, identity, and the natural world through vibrant colors and unexpected textures.

I believe art should invite curiosity and create conversation. Each piece I create tells a story—sometimes mine, sometimes yours, and often somewhere in between.

Featured Works

"Fragments of Autumn"

Mixed media on canvas, 36" × 48"

A meditation on change and renewal, incorporating pressed leaves, handmade paper, and layers of translucent acrylics that shift with the light.

"Urban Whispers"

Textile assemblage with oil pastel, 24" × 30"

Inspired by city landscapes at dusk, this piece weaves together found fabric, photographs, and hand-stitched elements to create a tactile urban landscape.

"Echoes of Home"

Collage with watercolor and ink, 18" × 24"

An exploration of belonging, featuring fragments of old letters, maps, and botanical drawings layered with delicate washes of color.

View Full Gallery →

Upcoming Events

Solo Exhibition: "Between Worlds" at Riverside Gallery
May 15 - June 30, 2025

Artist Talk: Creative Process Workshop at Portland Art Center
June 12, 2025 | 2:00 PM

Art Fair: Pacific Northwest Arts Festival
July 8-10, 2025 | Booth #42

See All Events →

Recent Recognition

"Emma Reyes creates layered worlds that invite viewers to look closer, then closer still—revealing intimate stories within stories."

— Northwest Arts Magazine, March 2025

"Her innovative use of materials transforms everyday objects into meaningful narratives that resonate with authentic emotion."

— Contemporary Art Review, January 2025

Studio Process

My practice is deeply rooted in experimentation and intuition. I begin each piece with a concept or feeling, but allow the materials to guide me through the creation process. My studio is filled with collections of found objects, handmade papers, fabric scraps, and natural elements that often find their way into my work.

I invite you to follow my creative journey on Instagram where I share works in progress, studio glimpses, and the small moments of inspiration that fuel my practice.

Let's Connect

I'm always open to collaborations, commissions, and conversations about art. Whether you're interested in adding a piece to your collection, discussing a custom work, or just sharing thoughts on creativity, I'd love to hear from you.

Contact Me →

title: about
plain:
About Emma Reyes

Artist, Educator, Explorer

My Artistic Journey

Born and raised in the Pacific Northwest, I've always been drawn to the intersection of natural beauty and human creativity. My journey as an artist began with traditional painting, but quickly evolved to incorporate a diverse range of materials and techniques.

After earning my MFA from the Pacific Northwest College of Art in 2015, I established my studio practice in Portland, where the vibrant art community and proximity to nature continue to inspire my work.

Artistic Approach

My work exists at the crossroads of several disciplines:

Mixed Media Painting - Combining traditional painting techniques with collage and assemblage

Textile Integration - Incorporating hand-stitched elements and fabric remnants

Natural Elements - Using found objects from nature to create texture and meaning

Sustainable Practices - Emphasizing repurposed materials and environmental consciousness

I believe that art should be accessible without sacrificing depth. My pieces invite viewers to approach them on multiple levels—appreciating initial beauty while discovering layers of meaning with continued engagement.

Education & Training

MFA in Contemporary Art Practice - Pacific Northwest College of Art, 2015

BA in Fine Arts - University of Washington, 2011

Artist Residency - Sitka Center for Art and Ecology, 2018

Master Workshop - Mixed Media Techniques with Claire Thompson, 2019

Teaching & Community

Alongside my studio practice, I'm passionate about arts education. I regularly lead workshops for adults and youth at the Portland Art Center, focusing on experimental techniques and creative exploration.

I believe strongly in art as a tool for community building and social change. Through my involvement with the Arts for All initiative, I help bring creative opportunities to underserved neighborhoods throughout Portland.

Personal Influences

My work is deeply influenced by:

The textural complexity of the Pacific Northwest landscape

Japanese aesthetic principles, particularly wabi-sabi

The feminist art movement of the 1970s

Contemporary collage artists like Wangechi Mutu and Mark Bradford

The poetry of Mary Oliver and her attention to natural detail

When not in the studio, you'll find me hiking with my dog Luna, foraging for natural materials, or exploring small galleries and museums across the region.
html:
About Emma Reyes

Artist, Educator, Explorer

My Artistic Journey

Born and raised in the Pacific Northwest, I've always been drawn to the intersection of natural beauty and human creativity. My journey as an artist began with traditional painting, but quickly evolved to incorporate a diverse range of materials and techniques.

After earning my MFA from the Pacific Northwest College of Art in 2015, I established my studio practice in Portland, where the vibrant art community and proximity to nature continue to inspire my work.

Artistic Approach

My work exists at the crossroads of several disciplines:

  • Mixed Media Painting - Combining traditional painting techniques with collage and assemblage
  • Textile Integration - Incorporating hand-stitched elements and fabric remnants
  • Natural Elements - Using found objects from nature to create texture and meaning
  • Sustainable Practices - Emphasizing repurposed materials and environmental consciousness

I believe that art should be accessible without sacrificing depth. My pieces invite viewers to approach them on multiple levels—appreciating initial beauty while discovering layers of meaning with continued engagement.

Education & Training

  • MFA in Contemporary Art Practice - Pacific Northwest College of Art, 2015
  • BA in Fine Arts - University of Washington, 2011
  • Artist Residency - Sitka Center for Art and Ecology, 2018
  • Master Workshop - Mixed Media Techniques with Claire Thompson, 2019

Teaching & Community

Alongside my studio practice, I'm passionate about arts education. I regularly lead workshops for adults and youth at the Portland Art Center, focusing on experimental techniques and creative exploration.

I believe strongly in art as a tool for community building and social change. Through my involvement with the Arts for All initiative, I help bring creative opportunities to underserved neighborhoods throughout Portland.

Personal Influences

My work is deeply influenced by:

  • The textural complexity of the Pacific Northwest landscape
  • Japanese aesthetic principles, particularly wabi-sabi
  • The feminist art movement of the 1970s
  • Contemporary collage artists like Wangechi Mutu and Mark Bradford
  • The poetry of Mary Oliver and her attention to natural detail

When not in the studio, you'll find me hiking with my dog Luna, foraging for natural materials, or exploring small galleries and museums across the region.

title: contact
plain:
Contact

Let's Start a Conversation

Get in Touch

I'm always excited to discuss art, potential collaborations, commissions, or exhibition opportunities. Whether you have a specific project in mind or just want to share your thoughts on my work, please reach out!

Email: studio@emmareyes.com

Phone: (503) 555-0123

Location: Portland, OR

Send Me a Message

Have a question or want to work together? Fill out the form below, and I'll get back to you within 48 hours.

Send Message

Studio Visits

My Portland studio is open for visits by appointment. Studio visits provide an opportunity to see works in progress, browse available pieces, and discuss potential commissions in person.

Follow Me

Connect with me on social media for updates on my latest work and creative process:

Instagram

Pinterest

Artsy

LinkedIn

Office Hours

Monday - Friday: 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM (PST)

Weekends: By appointment only

Looking forward to connecting and sharing my artistic journey with you!

title: cats
plain:
Cat Collection

A Study in Feline Grace and Beauty

The Elegance of Cats

Welcome to my cat photography collection. These fascinating creatures have been my artistic muse for years. Through my lens, I capture their mysterious nature, playful spirits, and quiet dignity.

Each photograph tells a story of companionship, independence, and the special bond we share with these extraordinary animals.

Featured Cats

"Whiskers in Sunlight"

Digital photography, natural lighting

This portrait captures the serene moment of a cat basking in the afternoon sun, highlighting the delicate whiskers and contemplative gaze.

"Midnight Hunter"

Low-light photography, natural setting

A study in contrast and shadow, revealing the predatory grace and focus of our feline companions.

"Curious Companion"

Candid moment, studio lighting

This image captures the inquisitive nature of cats, always exploring and investigating their surroundings with careful attention.

View Full Gallery →

Artist's Statement

Cats have been my inspiration for over a decade. Their ability to be simultaneously wild and domestic, aloof and affectionate, continues to fascinate me. Through these photographs, I hope to share the quiet moments of connection and the glimpses of ancient instinct that make cats such extraordinary subjects.

title: landscape
plain:
Natural Landscapes

Capturing Earth's Breathtaking Moments

Nature's Canvas

These landscape photographs document my journey through diverse terrains and changing seasons. From misty mountains to serene lakeshores, each image represents a moment of connection with the natural world.

I strive to capture not just the visual beauty of these places, but also the feeling of being present in these powerful environments.

Featured Landscapes

"Dawn's Embrace"

Sunrise photography, natural color

The first light of day transforms an ordinary scene into something magical, revealing layers of color and texture often missed in the full light of day.

"Ancient Stones"

Golden hour photography, wide angle

This composition explores the relationship between earth and sky, highlighting the timelessness of natural formations against the ever-changing heavens.

"Mist Valley"

Morning photography, atmospheric conditions

Capturing the ethereal quality of morning fog as it drifts through the valley, creating a dreamlike landscape that exists between worlds.

View Full Collection →

Locations

My landscape work has taken me from the Pacific Northwest forests to the dramatic coastlines of New Zealand. Each location presents unique challenges and rewards for landscape photography:

Mountain Ranges: Playing with scale and perspective

Coastal Areas: Capturing the dynamic relationship between land and sea

Forests: Finding composition within chaos

Deserts: Minimalism and the power of open space

I believe in minimal post-processing, preferring instead to wait for the perfect natural conditions that bring a landscape to life.

Environmental Statement

These photographs are not just art but also a record of our natural heritage. Through my work, I hope to inspire appreciation and conservation of these increasingly fragile environments.
